greenmirror.client

Interface ModelInitializer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GroovyScriptModelInitializer

    public interface ModelInitializer
    The interface that defines how model initializers should be structured.

    The order of executing is: setParameter(String), prepare() and executeInitializer(). The complete set of available model initializers is first prepared before they are all executed.

    Author:
    Karim El Assal

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  ModelInitializer.PreparationException
      A custom exception for use by the ModelInitializer implementations.

    • Method Detail

      • getIdentifier

        @NonNull java.lang.String getIdentifier()
        Returns:
        a unique identifier for this ModelInitializer used on the command line

      • getParameterSpecification

        @NonNull java.lang.String getParameterSpecification()
        Returns:
        a specification of the parameters used in a help message

      • getController

        Client getController()
        Returns:
        the GreenMirror controller

      • setController

        void setController(@NonNull Client controller)
        Parameters:
        controller - the GreenMirror controller to set

      • setParameter

        void setParameter(java.lang.String parameter)
        Parameters:
        parameter - parameter to store

      • prepare

        void prepare()
      throws ModelInitializer.PreparationException
        Do some preparing, like retrieving the contents of a file.
        Throws:
        ModelInitializer.PreparationException - if something goes wrong during the preparation

      • executeInitializer

        void executeInitializer()
        Execute the model initializer. After executing, the model should be known to the application.
